meanings.definition: Snools (verb): to deceive or trick someone
meanings.sent1: She snools her brother by hiding his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The magician snools the audience with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat snools the dog by leading him on a wild chase.
meanings.sent4: The con artist snools innocent people out of their money with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The sly fox snools the other animals by pretending to be their friend.

meanings.definition: Snools (noun): a foolish or gullible person
meanings.sent1: Don't be a snools and fall for that obvious scam.
meanings.sent2: He was often taken advantage of because he was known as a snools.
meanings.sent3: The snools believed everything he read on the internet, no matter how ridiculous.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a snools for trusting the smooth-talking salesman.
meanings.sent5: The old man was seen as a snools by the neighborhood kids for his naivety.
